critique: This document establishes a code of fair competition for the Candy Manufacturing Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. It reflects a strong interventionist approach to the economy, typical of the New Deal era. There is no direct impact on immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The document centralizes power in the federal government through the Administrator for Industrial Recovery. The executive power is expanded as the President approves and orders the code, with the ability to stay certain provisions. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
